business.headline: India–US trade deal announced, but why the fine print remains crucialUS President Donald Trump called the changes "effective immediately" on Truth Social, and Prime Minister Narendra Modi confirmed the development shortly afterward. Yet the absence of the actual agreement means much of the deal is being read between the lines rather than from a published document.

Silver, gold rates today: Why prices are rising after recent crashOn the Multi Commodity Exchange, silver prices jumped sharply, while gold also posted strong gains in early trade. MCX silver was trading around Rs 2,53,792 per kg, up Rs 17,531 or 7.42% as of 10 am. MCX gold was near Rs 1,49,101 per 10 grams, higher by Rs 5,110 or 3.55%.

Adani Enterprises stock surges 10% on India–US trade deal. Check top gainersThe India–US trade deal has supercharged sentiment, lifting Adani stocks and other heavyweights sharply. Here's a look at the top gainers as markets rally hard after the landmark announcement.

India-US trade deal: Why it's good news for Sensex, Nifty and the rupeeThe India–US trade deal lifts a long-standing weight off investors' shoulders, giving the Sensex, Nifty and the rupee a cleaner runway. With clarity finally restored, the market's next leg higher suddenly looks more believable.

Sensex jumps 2,500 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,271.45 points to 83,937.54, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 691.70 points to 25,780.10 as of 9:28 am. The sharp rise came as investors reacted to clarity on the India-US trade agreement, which had remained delayed for months and was seen as a key reason behind recent market weakness.

Did India really commit $500 billion to the US, or is the number just big talk?While US President Donald Trump laid out the figure in public, the Indian government has so far not specified what such a commitment involves, raising questions over its scale, timing and credibility.

Sensex jumps 2,300 points, Nifty surges as markets cheer India–US trade dealThe India–US trade deal has given the Sensex and Nifty their strongest tailwind in months, setting the stage for what could become a far more extended market surge.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market open higher on India-US trade deal?Early signals from the Gift Nifty point to a strong opening. Gift Nifty futures were trading at around 26,190 points at 8:26 am. This suggests that the Nifty 50 index could open nearly 4.5% higher than Monday's closing level of 25,088.4.

Capital gains tax on share buybacks is good for small investors. Here's whyThe government has shifted buyback taxation to a capital gains framework, while tightening rules for promoters who were seen as misusing buybacks as a tax-saving tool.

US, India seal trade deal after PM-Trump call: 5 things that changed overnightInstead of leaving the details to official statements, US President Donald Trump chose to spell out the trade deal himself, framing it as a result of personal diplomacy and immediate action.

Trump announces India trade deal, cuts tariffs to 18% after call with PM ModiAlso shedding light on the much-awaited US-India trade deal, which had faced several roadblocks with New Delhi adamant about not opening its agriculture sector to Washington, Trump said that an agreement is finally on the cards. Trump said he lowered the reciprocal tariffs following discussions with PM Modi, describing the move as a gesture of "friendship and respect."

Budget 2026: 7 key takeaways for individual taxpayersThe Union Budget 2026 may not have changed income tax rates, but it brings several practical updates that affect how individuals file returns, disclose income and deal with compliance. From easier timelines to simpler rules, here are the key takeaways taxpayers should know.

Silver ETF takes a hit: Down Rs 2 lakh, what should investors do now?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), silver prices have dropped sharply from their record peak, while gold has also seen a strong correction.

Silver prices crash Rs 17,000 today. More correction ahead?After touching record highs in recent weeks, silver prices have cooled sharply. The metal has slipped by nearly Rs 17,000, prompting investors to pause and reassess whether this fall is a buying opportunity or a sign to stay cautious.
Sensex ends 944 points higher: Why stock market rose today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 943.52 points to close at 81,666.46, while the NSE Nifty50 added 262.95 points to end at 25,088.40.

From stronger banks to easier credit: Who stands to gain from Budget 2026?A key announcement in the Budget was the proposal to set up a High-Level Committee on Banking for Viksit Bharat. The committee will undertake a comprehensive review of the sector and suggest reforms to align it with India's next stage of economic growth.
Nithin Kamath says STT hike won't curb F&O trade. Here's whyIn the Union Budget 2026, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced an increase in STT on futures and options trades.

Cigarettes to cost more now: Check the latest pricesSmokers are now paying more at the counter. From February 1, cigarette prices have gone up following a fresh tax hike, marking the first increase in nearly seven years.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall. Should you buy now?Gold and silver prices have tumbled sharply over the past few days. Read on to know the reason behind the rapid decline, and whether investors should buy or wait for further correction.

Why the government raised STT, making F&O trading more expensiveFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made it clear in her Budget speech that the Securities Transaction Tax, or STT, will go up for derivatives trades from April 1, 2026.

entertainment.headline: Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana to be unveiled on Ram Navami at Gateway of India: Report Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana will unveil its first character looks at a grand Ram Navami event at Mumbai's Gateway of India, with cast and political leaders expected.

Dhurandhar 2 teaser: Ranveer Singh is back as Hamza with more gore and chaos Dhurandhar 2 teaser poster revealed Ranveer Singh in a darker, deadlier avatar. Titled Dhurandhar: The Revenge, the spy-action sequel releases on March 19, 2026, in multiple Indian languages.

The 50 Day 2 highlights: Prince admits Roadies bias; Rajat Dalal, Digvijay clash The 50 turned explosive on Day 2 as Prince Narula admitted to favouring certain Roadies contestants. Meanwhile, Rajat Dalal and Digvijay Singh got into a violent altercation during the task, and Nikki Tamboli reignited her rivalry with Arya.

Dhurandhar 2: JioHotstar acquires streaming rights, music label changes JioHotstar has acquired the streaming rights for Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar: The Revenge.' Other than OTT, there has been a shift in music labels as well.

Kim Kardashian, Lewis Hamilton spark dating rumours with joint Paris arrival Kim Kardashian and Lewis Hamilton made a joint appearance in Paris, fuelling speculation about a potential romance as they were photographed arriving at a hotel following reports of a private getaway.

Big B recalls father Harivansh Rai Bachchan in a poetic note on life and struggle Amitabh Bachchan shared a late-night reflective note on life and struggle, recalling words of wisdom from his father Harivansh Rai Bachchan and drawing parallels with poet Firaq Gorakhpuri.

Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan's film to be directed by Nelson, promo shoot soon: Report Tamil cinema icons Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan are set to join forces in a new project directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, with a special promotional shoot expected to commence in the coming week. An official announcement is expected.

Ustad Amjad Ali Khan reacts to first Grammy win with sons Amaan, Ayaan His Holiness the Dalai Lama won his first Grammy Award at 90 for the album Meditations. The collaboration with Indian classical musicians highlights music as a bridge for peace and compassion globally.

Dhurandhar The Revenge: Ranveer Singh's 1st look poster promises a blood riot Ranveer Singh revealed the first look poster of 'Dhurandhar: The Revenge' on Tuesday, just before the film's teaser launch. The sequel, directed by Aditya Dhar, is scheduled to arrive in theatres on March 19.

Akshay Kumar joins Rohit Shetty's Golmaal 5 as lead antagonist: Report Akshay Kumar has been cast as the lead antagonist in Rohit Shetty's Golmaal 5. The film, led by Ajay Devgn, promises a fresh fantasy twist while retaining the franchise's iconic humour and ensemble cast.

Rakul Preet Singh slams Bollywood's paid PR culture: Good work speaks for itself Rakul Preet Singh has spoken out against Bollywood's growing paid PR culture, calling it negative and unnecessary while asserting that genuine work ultimately finds its own recognition.

Aamir Khan visits Arijit in Bengal, flies kite days after singer's retirement Singer Arijit Singh has announced that he will no longer take new playback assignments, prompting widespread reactions in the music industry. After the announcement, Aamir Khan visited Singh's home in Jiaganj, West Bengal.

Director Tharun Bhascker addresses Sai Sushanth's exit from ENE sequel Director Tharun Bhascker opened up about his reaction to Sai Sushanth Reddy's decision to not return for the sequel to Ee Nagaraniki Emaindi and discussed the direction of the upcoming film.

Kelly Clarkson announces end of talk show to focus on her children Kelly Clarkson has announced that The Kelly Clarkson Show will end with its seventh season as she decides to step back from daily hosting duties to prioritise her children.

Mardaani 3 box office Day 4: Rani's film sees 1st Monday dip after Rs 19-crore haul The latest installment in the 'Mardaani' franchise registers modest box office returns, collecting Rs 2.15 crore on its first Monday and facing mixed reactions from audiences and critics.

BTS comeback goes global with Netflix: Live concert, documentary; details to know   BTS are set to make their highly anticipated global return with BTS THE COMEBACK LIVE | ARIRANG, a landmark live performance streaming exclusively on Netflix on March 21.

Thursday Special short film review: Of marriage, meal and a quiet betrayal Thursday Special short film review: Thursday Special tells the story of an ageing couple's hidden emotional distance. The film highlights how small betrayals can deeply affect long-term relationships.

Is Jana Nayagan with revising committee? Censor board official tight-lipped Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan faces continued delay due to censor certificate issues. The ongoing legal battle raises questions about film certification transparency and procedural fairness.

Lawrence Bishnoi gang plotted to kill Rohit Shetty? FIR reveals chilling details The Lawrence Bishnoi gang has claimed responsibility, and four people have been arrested in connection with the incident.

general news.headline: Can't play with India's right to privacy, Supreme Court warns WhatsApp, MetaThe Supreme Court issued a stern warning to tech giant Meta, the parent company of WhatsApp, over the platform's privacy policies.

Patience bore fruit: In PM's remarks on US trade deal, a message for OppositionAddressing the NDA Parliamentary Party meeting, PM Modi said the landmark India-US trade deal had created a favourable economic environment and demonstrated the government's steady approach to global trade talks.

Not a word, no Nobel support: How PM Modi got Trump to cut tariffsPM Modi, without any confrontation or provocation, let patience do the heavy lifting. Eventually, the US's loudest dealmaker blinked, without PM Modi having to say a word or resorting to massaging Trump's ego.

Why Baloch women are taking up arms, raining death on Pak forcesBaloch women fighters played a key role in the BLA's recent coordinated attacks across Balochistan. The involvement of women in the Baloch armed movement is part of the broader trend. After peaceful protests over enforced disappearances and exploitations failed, with men jailed or killed, the once-silent Baloch women are picking up arms, and even turning suicide bombers.

At Stanford, are students posing as Jains to bypass $7,944 meal plan?Stanford University faces scrutiny after unverified claims emerged that some students allegedly misuse Jain dietary exemptions to evade the school's costly mandatory meal plans. The allegations have sparked an online debate over religious accommodations, student trust, and the rising cost of campus dining at elite universities.

Live: Lok Sabha adjourned till 2 pm amid chaos, Opposition sloganeeringParliament Session Live Updates: The Lok Sabha will resume today after Monday's proceedings were disrupted over Rahul Gandhi's reference to the former Army Chief's unpublished memoir. Chaotic scenes erupted as BJP members, including Home Minister Amit Shah and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, objected, arguing that only formally published material could be quoted in the House. The House was adjourned multiple times: first till 3 pm, then 4 pm, before being suspended for the day as Gandhi insisted on speaking about the 2020 India-China border standoff. Amid the row, Congress MPs are scheduled to meet at 10.30 am in the Congress Parliamentary Party office in Parliament. Stay tuned to inditatoday.in to get all the latest updates on the Parliament session.

India's zero-tariff pledge in US trade deal: What it means Live UpdatesIf carried out, the move would mark a significant shift in India's long-standing trade approach, which has traditionally depended on protective measures to support domestic industries. It could open the door wider to US agricultural goods, energy supplies and manufactured products.

India gains tariff advantage over China, Pak, Bangladesh in US trade dealThe 50 per cent US levy included a 25 per cent reciprocal tariff and an additional 25 per cent import duty imposed over India's purchase of Russian crude oil. With the new deal, Washington has removed the extra penalty and lowered the overall rate.

Women are being secretly filmed with smart glasses. You could be next!Women's safety has hit a new low, with technology designed for convenience now being turned into tools of harassment. Case in point: smart glasses.

Live: India pact to boost American farm exports, says US agriculture secretaryUS-India Trade Deal Live Updates: US President Donald Trump has announced a cut in tariffs on Indian goods from 25 per cent to 18 per cent after speaking with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, signalling an easing of strained ties. PM Modi welcomed the move, saying "Made in India" products would now face lower tariffs and thanked Trump for the decision. The US President said the cut followed PM's request and reflected friendship and respect. Trump also said a long-pending India-US trade deal is now close, despite earlier disagreements, especially over agriculture. He added that PM had agreed to reduce purchases of Russian oil and shift imports towards the US and Venezuela. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Sensex jumps 2,300 points, Nifty surges as markets cheer India–US trade dealThe India–US trade deal has given the Sensex and Nifty their strongest tailwind in months, setting the stage for what could become a far more extended market surge.

India agreed to stop buying Russian oil, says Trump while announcing trade dealTrump announced that India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil and increase purchases from the US after months of trade pressure and tariff threats over New Delhi's energy ties with Moscow. While the US has framed the move as a strategic win linked to the Ukraine war, India hasn't mentioned Russian oil yet.

Dhurandhar 2 teaser: Ranveer Singh is back as Hamza with more gore and chaosDhurandhar 2 teaser poster revealed Ranveer Singh in a darker, deadlier avatar. Titled Dhurandhar: The Revenge, the spy-action sequel releases on March 19, 2026, in multiple Indian languages.

Air India orders fuel switch checks after Boeing Dreamliner malfunctions mid-airAir India has initiated a precautionary fleet-wide inspection of fuel control switches on its Boeing 787 Dreamliners following a defect reported on a London-Bengaluru flight. This move underscores the airline's commitment to safety amid ongoing scrutiny after last year's fatal Boeing 787 crash.

Did India really commit $500 billion to the US, or is the number just big talk?While US President Donald Trump laid out the figure in public, the Indian government has so far not specified what such a commitment involves, raising questions over its scale, timing and credibility.

India–US trade deal announced, but why the fine print remains crucialUS President Donald Trump called the changes "effective immediately" on Truth Social, and Prime Minister Narendra Modi confirmed the development shortly afterward. Yet the absence of the actual agreement means much of the deal is being read between the lines rather than from a published document.

Kim Kardashian, Lewis Hamilton spark dating rumours with joint Paris arrivalKim Kardashian and Lewis Hamilton made a joint appearance in Paris, fuelling speculation about a potential romance as they were photographed arriving at a hotel following reports of a private getaway.

PM Modi gets hero's welcome at NDA Parliamentary meet after India-US trade dealAfter a phone call with Prime Minister Modi, President Donald Trump announced that India and the US agreed to a trade deal under which Washington will bring down reciprocal tariffs on Indian goods to 18 per cent from the current 25 per cent.

Ex-Army chief's memoir and Rule 349: Why Rahul Gandhi was stopped by SpeakerSpeaker Om Birla referred to Rule 349 to bar Rahul Gandhi from making any references to magazine article that quotes former Army Chief General MM Naravane's yet-to-be published book. But what exactly does Rule 349 entail?

Bill Gates, Russian girl, and a closer look at Epstein shadow on tech biggiesIt looks like no one in the world who is somebody has remained untouched by Jeffrey Epstein. His latest emails released by the US government show that Epstein was also quite pally with a number of tech biggies, including Bill Gates who is mentioned in the emails alongside a Russian prostitute and a case of STD.

Sky turns blue again: Suryakumar Yadav's timely rise ahead of T20 World CupIndia's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav was enduring horrendous form in the lead-up to the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. However, just 1 month ahead of the tournament, the sky has turned blue once again for the India skipper.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 20 | Bearded Beginning: Rebel's Roots And Rationalist RoarI have not just been reading, researching, writing and speaking on Periyar from my early years, but in the process internalised and imbibed him impulsively, instinctively and now I fear, irrevocably. He has got under my skin and settled in my system so pervasively I almost feel I am growing a beard.

Artemis-II wet test terminated due to hydrogen leak in Moon rocketThis scrub likely pushes back the earliest Artemis II launch window, previously eyed for early February 2026, including dates like February 8.

sports.headline: Tests over T20? Cummins says he did not want to risk himself for World Cup Australia fast bowler Pat Cummins has broken his silence on missing the T20 World Cup. Cummins has explained why he did not want to risk himself in the world tournament.

Karim Benzema joins Al Hilal: How the transfer caused a Ronaldo riot in Saudi Benzema's move to Al-Hilal and Ronaldo's protest have exposed cracks in Saudi football's power balance. What began as squad building has spiralled into a league-wide debate on fairness, control and ambition.

CSK in WPL? Team to start investing in women's cricket, reveals CEO Chennai Super Kings are set to invest in women's cricket, confirmed the team's CEO Kasi Viswanathan. Till now, CSK has stayed away from investing in women's cricket despite the advent of the WPL.

Despite thrashing vs Pakistan, Ponting backs Australia to reach top 4 in T20 WC T20 World Cup: Former cricketer Ricky Ponting has backed Australia to reach the semi-final of the T20 World Cup. Ponting has shown confidence in the side, despite the team getting battered by Pakistan in the 3-match T20I series.

Watch: Ishan Kishan cracks up revisiting old viral clip with Rohit Sharma Ishan Kishan burst into laughter revisiting an old viral clip with Rohit Sharma, joking about how three missed matches turned into two lost years. The throwback landed just as his red-hot form reignited his T20 World Cup push.

Sky turns blue again: Suryakumar Yadav's timely rise ahead of T20 World Cup India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav was enduring horrendous form in the lead-up to the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. However, just 1 month ahead of the tournament, the sky has turned blue once again for the India skipper.

ISL picks FanCode over JioHotstar: Value drops from Rs 1.68 cr to Rs 9.5 lakh FanCode has announced as the new broadcast partner of the Indian Super League after beating JioStar in the bidding war. The deal finally clears the way for the delayed ISL season to restart on February 14.

Pakistan pulling off a drama with India boycott in T20 World Cup: Harbhajan Harbhajan Singh has torn into Pakistan's India-match boycott call, calling it staged drama. The former spinner challenged the PCB to hold its nerve and avoid another familiar U-turn at the T20 World Cup.

Why did Ronaldo not play in Al Nassr vs Al Riyadh? Controversy explained Cristiano Ronaldo's unexplained absence from Al Nassr's league clash has ignited strike rumours and exposed growing tensions behind the scenes. At stake is not fitness, but power, ambition, and his future in Saudi football itself.

Legal or illegal? Indian umpire gives verdict on Usman Tariq's bowling action Former umpire Anil Chaudhary has declared Usman Tariq's bowling action legal after scrutiny in the Australia series. The decision comes amid debates sparked by Cameron Green's on-field gestures and previous suspicions in the Pakistan Super League.

Sri Lanka back Kamindu Mendis for T20 World Cup, Dhananjaya de Silva dropped from squad Sri Lanka have recalled Kamindu Mendis to their T20 World Cup squad despite his modest returns in the format, while the co-hosts have opted to leave out veteran all-rounder Dhananjaya de Silva.

USA send T20 World Cup warning with strong show against India A in warm-up gameUSA delivered a strong performance against India A in the T20 World Cup 2026 warm-up match. Tilak Varma's fitness return and Ravi Bishnoi's performance were the major positives for India in the fixture.

IND vs NZ: KCA acts on inflated water prices during Thiruvananthapuram T20IKerala Cricket Association has launched an investigation into inflated water prices for fans during the India vs New Zealand fifth T20I in Thiruvananthapuram. Several videos and posts circulating on social media showed spectators being charged above the permitted rates at certain sections of the Greenfield International stadium.

AUS vs ENG, U19 World Cup semi-final Live Streaming: When and where to watchU19 World Cup: Australia and England are all set to face each other in the first semi-final of the tournament on Tuesday, February 3 in Bulawayo. Both teams are unbeaten, having won all their five matches.

Carlos Alcaraz withdraws from Rotterdam Open hours after maiden Australian Open titleCarlos Alcaraz withdrew from the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam on Monday, just hours after clinching his maiden Australian Open title. The Spaniard, who lifted the trophy at the ATP 500 event last season, will not return to defend his crown at the indoor hard-court tournament.

No India-Pakistan game in T20 World Cup may cause USD 250 million losses to ICCNo India-Pakistan match in the T20 World Cup 2026, scheduled to be played in Colombo, could cause significant financial losses to ICC to the tune of USD 250 million, according to estimates. The Pakistan government has asked its team not to participate in the India fixture but play the entire tournament.

BCCI's handling of Mustafizur saga sparked T20 World Cup crisis: ex-ICC officialFormer International Cricket Council (ICC) Head of Communications Sami-ul-Hasan Burney on Monday said the BCCI could have avoided the current T20 World Cup turmoil by handling Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit with greater discretion.

Umpiring blunder? Pakistan keeper makes foolish stumping error, but gets luckyPakistan wicketkeeper Khawaja Nafay made a controversial stumping to dismiss Cooper Connolly off Mohammad Nawaz. On Sunday, Pakistan beat Australia by 111 runs to sweep the T20I series 3-0.

T20 World Cup warm-up: Tilak Varma's brisk 38 sparks hopes of swift comebackTilak Varma returned to competitive cricket after recovering from an abdominal injury. His strong performance raises hopes for India in the upcoming T20 World Cup but sparks selection challenges.

Meg Lanning, fuelled with fire, confirms WPL 2027 return after horror seasonMeg Lanning has confirmed her return to the Women's Premier League in 2027 after a difficult season with UP Warriorz. Her comeback signals a strong desire to compete and lead despite recent challenges.

Mary Kom apologises for 'didn't earn a single rupee' dig at ex-husband OnlerIndian boxing icon Mary Kom has issued a public apology after her remarks about ex-husband K Onler Kom on a television chat show sparked backlash on social media. The comments were made during an emotional discussion about her personal life and have kept the six-time world champion in the spotlight in recent weeks.

Is Mohsin Naqvi now cricket's troublemaker-in-chief?From handshake rows to World Cup boycotts, Mohsin Naqvi has kept cricket on edge. His confrontations with India have turned administration into spectacle, dragging the game into politics instead of letting it breathe.

Pakistan travel to Sri Lanka for T20 World Cup 2026 amid India boycott stancePakistan cricket team has left for Sri Lanka to participate in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 after their government denied them permission to play against India. This boycott raises concerns from the ICC and may affect Pakistan's cricketing future globally.

Suspicious or just strange? Parthiv Patel baffled by Pakistan U19's tactics vs IndiaU19 World Cup: Parthiv Patel said that he was surprised with Pakistan's approach and their lack of intent to qualify for the semis when they played in the Super 6 clash against India on Sunday.

ICC can't punish Pakistan for boycotting India at T20 World Cup: Ex-chairmanFormer International Cricket Council chairman Ehsan Mani has said the ICC cannot punish Pakistan for boycotting its marquee ICC Men's T20 World Cup group-stage match against India, arguing that the decision was taken on government instructions and therefore leaves little scope for sanctions.

Babar Azam breaks Virat Kohli's record, bounces back to form ahead of T20 World CupBabar Azam broke Virat Kohli's record for most T20I fifties as Pakistan dominated Australia in a 3-0 series whitewash. Pakistan have warmed up in style for the upcoming T20 World Cup by defeating Australia.

India batter reveals dark side of facing hate, trolls over her looksWPL 2026: India Women's batter Bharti Fulmali has spoken candidly about enduring online hate and trolling over her looks, admitting the mental toll it has taken over the last three years.

Will F1 return to India? Efforts underway to bring race back to Buddh circuitThe Indian government is actively working to bring back the Formula 1 Grand Prix to the Buddh International Circuit after more than 10 years. Efforts focus on resolving tax and regulatory issues that previously caused the event's cancellation, signalling a potential revival in the near future.

ICC right to warn Pakistan over India boycott in T20 World Cup: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla has supported the ICC's decision to warn Pakistan of severe repercussions for its selective pullout from the high-profile T20 World Cup clash against India in Colombo on February 15.

Watch out for Anahat at LA Olympics: India proud as squash star wins major titleParth Jindal, founder of JSW Sports, hailed Anahat Singh's maiden PSA Bronze-level title and said the entire nation should keep an eye on the young squash star at the 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
